main event: A ground-visual observation of a single object that appeared like a white star, the size of a match head, which changed colors slightly and seemed to get smaller and smaller over 5-10 minutes in Dayton, Ohio on August 27, 1956.
interesting points: The object was observed to change colors slightly.
The object seemed to get smaller and smaller over the 5-10 minute observation period.
The object was positively identified as the planet Venus by Capt. Gregory.
The sighting was reported to and investigated by the Project Blue Book program.
A photograph was taken of the observed object.
sighted object: a single white star-like object that changed colors and appeared to shrink in size
